article.headline: SAINT JOSEPHS 55, BUFFALO 50
article.story:
PHILADELPHIA (Ticker) -- In a game where no one else could make 
a shot, Pat Carroll could not miss.

Carroll scored 26 points to lead St. Joseph's to a 55-50 victory
over Buffalo in the first round of the NIT.

The younger brother of NBA player Matt Carroll, Pat Carroll made
10-of-18 shots, including 4-of-9 3-pointers.  He was the only
player on either team to make more than half his shots.

St. Joseph's shot 40 percent (18-of-45) and held Buffalo to 32
percent (19-of-60).  The Hawks advanced to a second-round
matchup with Holy Cross on Monday.

Carroll had an answer for every charge by the Bulls (23-10).
When Buffalo scored the first five points of the second half,
Carroll hit a 3-pointer to make it 26-20.  He stopped another
5-0 spurt with a jumper that made it 30-25.

The Bulls rallied for a 42-40 lead with 3:36 left on an
alley-oop slam by Mark Bortz, who scored nine points.  Carroll
drilled a 3-pointer to give the Hawks the lead for good and
start a 7-0 run he capped with a jumper at the 2:03 mark to make
it 47-42.

With a defender draped all over him, Carroll hit a fallaway
jumper to make it 49-44 with 1:17 left.

Dwayne Jones had 10 points, 16 rebounds and four blocks for St.
Joseph's (21-11), which gave coach Phil Martelli his 200th
victory.

Turner Battle scored 12 points for Buffalo, which made just
3-of-18 3-pointers and 9-of-17 free throws.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
